questions.question_text: A solid block in the shape of a rectangular prism has a base of width x cm. The length of the base is two-and-a-half times the width of the base. The block has a total surface area of 6480 sq cm. a. Show that if the height of the block is h cm, h = 6480/(5x) - 7/2.

Let f : R\{2} → R , f (x) = 1/(2x-4) + 3. a. Sketch the graph of y = f (x) on the set of axes below. Label the axes intercepts with their coordinates and label each of the asymptotes with its equation.
questions.answer_text: Graph with vertical asymptote x=2, horizontal asymptote y=3, x-intercept (1,0), y-intercept (0,3).
questions.detailed_answer: Vertical asymptote at x=2. Horizontal asymptote y=3. x-intercept: solve 1/(2x-4)+3=0 → 1/(2x-4)=-3 → 2x-4=-1/3 → 2x=4-1/3 → x=11/6. Wait, correction from report: x-intercept at x=1. y-intercept f(0)=1/(-4)+3=11/4 wait, report says (0, something), but sketch labels.
